review: This is no doubt a game changer IF you live in the United States. As an American living in Germany, it does little for me. The only extras we get is YouTube, and that content is blocked by GEMA, a nationwide German musicians union which wants money for American music played in Germany. No other extra channels are offered.Frankly, if you live outside the USA, you are better off investing in an HDMIi cable,, or connecting a small computer to your television,.  If Google can ever find a way to think about the rest of the world market, they may actually make a dent.
author: Sylvain M. Metz

review: Love that this can be used in either TV or PC monitor with HDMI and watch Youtube videos or the browser (which includes videos in Full screen) as I hate regular TV programming. The only downside (hence the 4 not 5 stars) is its gets very HOT! when plugged in even when not being used. Have to remember to unplug it from AC when I finish. Have to figure that the heat may reduce the life of the unit which might explain some of the failures mentioned in other reviews.

review: We tried Chromecast with our iPads mainly due to the price being so much less than Apple TV.  However, downloading into a computer and then sending via WiFi to a television is not very convenient.  It requires a functioning and available WiFi which many times isn't the case.  On the other hand, Apple TV mirrors directly from my iPad to the TV.  I think the extra $50 for Apple TV was well worth the price.
author: Amazon Customer
